text: Do you all feel like the time is finally here? Or is it partially to also help force the change on clients? I know that the new edge updates include that ie11 feature but I imagine there are still lots of folks unwilling to adopt. But there really isnt a reason not to at this point.

I think it's been that time for 2ish years now, to drop it by default. If a client has specific needs, that's fine, but it's going to take longer to debug a modern design to fit an old browser like that. that cost should be passed on rather than us investing that additional time into EVERY project when 99% of our sites aren't seeing significant IE traffic

I totally agree with you. The use case that we primarily see a need for this actually doesnt come from visitors like you said but manufacturing clients who have legacy systems built on ie. And their internal teams refuse to update. I def think your average internet users has long since left ie11 but there are still a lot of businesses that rely on it. I think that this last edge update is really the final push to get them off it.

a rule of thumb I go by – if its a B2C site, then it’s a no-brainer to scrap IE. If its B2B, then look at the analytics to see if IE support needs to be scoped into the project (at the client’s expense, of course :wink:)
